body:
Comment 18 by **czarek.tomczak**: 
@comment #17 alex.bra...@gmail.com

I have no idea how to do such thing. I am using Chromium Embedded Framework from here:
https://code.google.com/p/chromiumembedded/

It integrates with multiple languages without problems. I am creating bindings for the
Go language. I think that this is something that should be fixed in Go, and not the
other way around.

How can I decrease the amount of memory that Go is trying to reserve?

Why Go doesn't let run application that requires less than 100 MB of ram to run? It
doesn't make sense to crash application when it only needs 100 MB of ram, and there is
712 MB of continous ram available. And 3 GB of free ram in total. It just doesn't sound
right.
